_header: Little wot it any man how derne love was found
Note: For a similar piece see 3138; for a secular version see 3136.
Subjects: Christ, love of; love, of Christ
_description: A song of the love of Christ — five 6-line stanzas with 2-line refrain after each, ‘Ever and o night and day he haveth us in his thoghte / He nul nout leose þat he so deore boghte’

CamGon512.Transcription:
Lytel wotyt onyman hu derne loue was fu[n]deBut he þat was on
                    Rode don and bouth vs wyth his wondeffor loue of man he made hym self vn
                    sundeHe haueth y kast a grysligast to grundeHe bouth vs wyth hys suete
                    blod hu myth he don vs more…
CamGon512.Note:
Ends imperfectly in second stanza. Written in lower margin below Latin
                    song with notation; perhaps intended to be sung to same tune.

BLHar2253.First Lines:
Lutel wot hit anymon hou loue hym haueþ yboundeþat for vs
                    o þe rode ron ant bohte vs wiþ is wounde…
BLHar2253.Last Lines:
…ffor loue of vs his wonges waxeþ þunnehis herte
                    blod he ȝef for al mon kunneEuer & oo etc.
